UK Income Tax and NI Guide 2025/26

The UK tax year runs from 6 April to 5 April. This calculator is based on the rates for 2025/26.

Income Tax Rates (England, Wales, NI)

The Personal Allowance is ¬£12,570. Income above this is taxed at:

Band Tax Rate Taxable Income
Personal Allowance0%¬£0 - ¬£12,570
Basic Rate20%¬£12,571 - ¬£50,270
Higher Rate40%¬£50,271 - ¬£125,140
Additional Rate45%¬£125,140+

National Insurance (NI) Rates 2025/26

Rates for self-employed (Class 4 NI + Class 2 NI) and employees (Class 1 NI).

Rate Income Range
0%¬£0 - ¬£12,570
8%¬£12,571 - ¬£50,270
2%Above ¬£50,270

Dividend Tax Rates 2025/26

Dividend income is taxed differently from employment or self-employment income:

  • Dividend Allowance: First ¬£500 tax-free
  • Basic Rate: 8.75%
  • Higher Rate: 33.75%
  • Additional Rate: 39.35%

Important Note: Scotland

Scotland has different income tax rates and bands from the rest of the UK (England, Wales, and Northern Ireland). This calculator uses the UK-wide rates and does not include the Scottish tax rates.
